places.name: Sch√∂nbrunn Palace
places.about: 18th-century summer palace with tours of lavish rococo ceremonial rooms, plus gardens with a maze.

places.name: St. Stephen's Cathedral
places.about: Medieval Roman Catholic place of worship with an ornate spire, catacombs & a treasury museum.

places.name: Belvedere Palace
places.about: Baroque, 18th-century palaces housing art from Middle Ages to today, with notable Klimt collection.

places.name: Albertina Museum
places.about: 19th-century Habsburg palace with staterooms & collections of old master prints & 20th-century art.

places.name: The Hofburg
places.about: Habsburg palace complex with ornate, baroque interiors, imperial apartments & a silver museum.

places.name: Et'hem Bey Mosque
places.about: Guided tours are offered at this 18th-century mosque with colorful frescoes in the city center.

places.name: Skanderbeg Square
places.about: Prominent central square featuring a national hero monument & surrounding historic buildings.

places.name: National Historical Museum
places.about: Major museum in a Communist-era building featuring themed exhibitions about the history of Albania.

places.name: Pyramid of Tirana
places.about: Opened in 1988 as the Enver Hoxha Museum, this large pyramidal structure is now a conference center.

places.name: Tirana Castle
places.about: Medieval castle of which only an Ottoman-era wall remains, now housing handicraft stores & eateries.

places.name: Parc Central
places.about: City green space along a river offering playgrounds & ponds along with walking paths & a bar/eatery.

places.name: Noblesa del temps - de Salvador Dal√≠
places.about: Riverside, surrealist bronze sculpture by artist Salvador Dal√≠, featuring a melting clock & angels.

places.name: Casa de la Vall
places.about: Iconic 1500s building with guided tours, used for the Andorran government from 1701 to 2011.

places.name: Pont de la Margineda
places.about: Charming stone footbridge from the late Middle Ages in a picturesque, natural setting.

places.name: Belarusian National Arts Museum
places.about: State museum exhibiting Belarusian & Russian painting & sculpture in a classical-style building.

places.name: Belarusian State Museum of the History of the Great Patriotic War
places.about: Established in 1944, this World War II museum features 24 exhibit halls in an iconic building.

places.name: Victory Park
places.about: Sizable riverfront green space with fountains & activities such as running, cycling & boating.

places.name: Grand Place
places.about: Huge city square completely encircled by elegant historic buildings dating back to the 14th century.

places.name: St Michael and St Gudula Cathedral, Brussels
places.about: Belgium's national church, host to royal weddings & funerals, built in the Brabant Gothic style.

places.name: Museum of Natural Sciences
places.about: Museum of natural history, from minerals to dinosaurs & animal specimens, with hands-on exhibits.

places.name: Royal Palace of Brussels
places.about: Palace of the constitutional monarchy, with throne & other state rooms open for tours each summer.

places.name: Parc du Cinquantenaire
places.about: Landscaped 19th-century city park with floral gardens & fountains, home to art & military museums.

places.name: Ba≈°ƒçar≈°ija
places.about: Dating back to the 1400s, this bustling market offers dining & shopping amid cultural landmarks.

places.name: Tunnel of Hope
places.about: Small military-history museum at the site of a storied Bosnian War‚Äìera underground tunnel.

places.name: Vrelo Bosne
places.about: Picturesque woodland park featuring a spring & pool, the source of the River Bosna, plus cafes.

places.name: Sebilj
places.about: Landmark wooden fountain built in the 18th century & resembling an ornate kiosk.

places.name: Museum of Crimes Against Humanity and Genocide
St. Alexander Nevsky Cathedral
places.about: Iconic Bulgarian Orthodox church with Neo-Byzantine architecture & an underground museum.

places.name: City Garden
places.about: Originating in 1872, this scenic park with a fountain & flowerbeds is a popular spot to play chess.

places.name: National Museum of History
places.about: Over 650,000 items show Bulgaria's history from prehistoric times to the more recent communist past.

places.name: St. George Rotunda Church
places.about: Sofia's oldest building, this 4th-century Christian church is cylindrical, with a frescoed dome.

places.name: St. Sofia Church
places.about: 6th-century Byzantine church with a largely brick interior, paintings & an underground crypt.

places.name: Lotr≈°ƒçak Tower
places.about: Large tower with daily cannon blasts & an observation area providing panoramic city views.

places.name: Park Maksimir
places.about: Family-friendly park with shaded trails, lakes & diverse wildlife, plus playgrounds & a zoo.

places.name: Zagreb City Museum
places.about: Local museum with artifacts & displays tracing the history of Zagreb from ancient to modern times.

places.name: Nikola Tesla Technical Museum
places.about: This science museum founded in 1954 houses historic equipment & an interactive Nikola Tesla exhibit.

places.name: Park Ribnjak
places.about: English-style, 19th century gardens, home to Art Park Zagreb & host to summer concerts.

places.name: Prague Castle
places.about: Vast castle complex with buildings revealing architecture from Roman-style to Gothic & 20th century.

places.name: Prague Astronomical Clock
places.about: Medieval timepiece on the facade of city hall displaying the twelve apostles as the clock strikes.

places.name: Charles Bridge
places.about: Landmark stone bridge linking Prague's Old & New Towns, with street artists & entertainers.

places.name: Old Town Square
places.about: Oldest square in the historic center with 10th-century origins, site of many Gothic buildings.

places.name: Pra≈°n√° br√°na
places.about: City gate built in the 15th century and restored after being damaged in the Battle of Prague.

places.name: Rosenborg Castle
places.about: Dutch Renaissance palace & gardens, including a museum housing the crown jewels, with guided tours.

places.name: Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek
places.about: Fine art museum with antique Mediterranean sculptures, plus 19th-century French & Danish works.

places.name: Christiansborg Palace
places.about: Tours of the royal palace's lavish reception rooms & stables, plus 12th-century castle remains.

places.name: Tivoli Gardens
places.about: 19th-century amusement park with antique roller coaster & live entertainment program.

places.name: Landboh√∏jskolens Have
places.about: Small university park with flower beds & a rose garden, plus shaded benches & a summer cafe.

places.name: Tallinn Town Hall
places.about: Gothic town hall built in 13th century on center square in medieval Old Town, with concerts & tours.

places.name: Alexander Nevsky Cathedral
places.about: Designed by Mikhail Preobrazhensky, this soaring edifice was funded by public donations.

places.name: Lennusadam
places.about: Maritime museum in a 16th-century tower with a submarine & a sunken ship from the 1560s.

places.name: Kadriorg Park
places.about: City park created in the 18th century, site of Kadriorg Palace, museums, monuments & formal gardens.

places.name: Viru Gate
places.about: Built in the 1300s, 2 large, ivy-covered watchtowers mark the entrance to Tallinn's Old Town.

places.name: Museum of Contemporary Art Kiasma
places.about: Contemporary art museum & cultural center with thematic annual exhibitions, a theater & events.

places.name: Suomenlinna
places.about: World Heritage site accessed by ferry, with cannons, tunnels, a dockyard, museums & a brewery.

places.name: Temppeliaukion Church
places.about: Unique church popular as a concert venue, with a copper-lined dome & rock/rubble interior walls.

places.name: The National Museum of Finland
places.about: Prehistoric artifacts, medieval treasures & 20th-century icons in a grandiose national museum.

places.name: Market Square
places.about: Harborside market open year-round with food stalls, handicrafts & a heated cafe tent in winter.

places.name: Eiffel Tower
places.about: Gustave Eiffel's iconic, wrought-iron 1889 tower, with steps and elevators to observation decks.

places.name: Louvre Museum
places.about: Former historic palace housing huge art collection, from Roman sculptures to da Vinci's 'Mona Lisa.'

places.name: Panth√©on
places.about: 18th-century mausoleum with colonnaded facade, housing remains of notable French citizens.

places.name: Arc de Triomphe
places.about: Iconic triumphal arch built to commemorate Napoleon's victories, with an observation deck.

places.name: The Basilica of Sacr√©-C≈ìur de Montmartre
places.about: Iconic, domed white church, completed in 1914, with interior mosaics, stained-glass windows & crypt.

places.name: Brandenburg Gate
places.about: Restored 18th-century gate & landmark with 12 Doric columns topped by a classical goddess statue.

places.name: Pergamon Museum
places.about: Museum complex housing ancient Roman & Greek art collections, plus Babylonian & Persian antiquities.

places.name: Reichstag
places.about: Neo-Renaissance parliament building topped by a Norman Foster glass dome with 360-degree city views.

places.name: Berlin Wall
places.about: Graffiti-covered remains of a Cold War barrier that divided the city, now a historical monument.

places.name: Alexanderplatz
places.about: Historic meeting and market place rebuilt post-war with modern buildings and 365-meter TV tower.

places.name: Acropolis of Athens
places.about: Ruins of iconic 5th-century B.C. temple complex on Athens' rocky hilltop undergoing restoration.

places.name: National Archaeological Museum
places.about: Neoclassical museum of Ancient Greek art & archaeology, with sculpture, metalwork, vases & jewelry.

places.name: Temple of Olympian Zeus
places.about: Vast temple begun in 6th century B.C. on the site of an ancient outdoor sanctuary dedicated to Zeus.

places.name: Athens Concert Hall
places.about: Large complex with 4 concert halls offering a lineup of musical, dance & theatrical performances.

places.name: Odeon of Herodes Atticus
places.about: Concerts & other performances are held at this restored stone theater constructed in 161 CE.

places.name: Buda Castle
places.about: Palatial venue for the Hungarian National Gallery plus displays from Gothic altars to sculpture.

places.name: Westend
places.about: Sprawling retail center with international chain stores, diverse food options & a movie theater.

places.name: Hungarian Parliament Building
places.about: Landmark Gothic Revival‚Äìstyle edifice with lavishly decorated rooms, plus a visitors' center.

places.name: Fisherman's Bastion
places.about: 19th-century fortress with 7 turreted lookout towers offering panoramic views plus cafe on terrace.

places.name: Sz√©chenyi Chain Bridge
places.about: Landmark 19th-century suspension bridge, designed by William Tierney Clark & illuminated at night.

places.name: Hallgrimskirkja
places.about: Inspired by Icelandic traditions, this modern cathedral, consecrated in 1986, has a 73m-high tower.

places.name: Perlan
places.about: Futuristic revolving glass-domed fine dining restaurant in park setting, with cocktail bar.

places.name: Sun Voyager
places.about: Huge 1990 stainless-steel sculpture of a boat by J√≥n Gunnar √Årnason, set on granite beside the sea.

places.name: National Museum of Iceland
places.about: Objects from the Settlement Age to the present, 20th-century photography & temporary exhibitions.

places.name: Kringlan
places.about: Vibrant mall featuring global retail shops, boutiques, fast-food chains, eateries & a supermarket.

places.name: Dublin Castle
places.about: Historic site, dating from 1204, with 2 museums, cafes and gardens, plus state rooms and a library.

places.name: Trinity College Dublin
places.about: 19-hectare university with Georgian buildings, known for its humanities, science & medical programs.

places.name: St Patrick's Cathedral
places.about: The Church of Ireland's national cathedral, dating from 1220, with regular musical recitals.

places.name: National Gallery of Ireland
places.about: Grand collection of European art spanning the 14th to the 21st-century, covering all major schools.

places.name: Jervis Shopping Centre
places.about: Established, multilevel mall with 55+ brand-name stores & casual eateries in an upbeat space.

places.name: Van Gogh Museum
places.about: Museum housing the world's largest collection of Van Gogh paintings, alongside drawings & letters.

places.name: Anne Frank House
places.about: Museum house where Anne Frank & her family hid from the Nazis in a secret annex, during WWII.

places.name: Amsterdam Canals
places.about: The historic urban ensemble of the canal area in Amsterdam was designed at the end of the 16th century and completed in the 17th century. It was a project for a new 'port-city,' to be built around the old d town between the old defence canal and the new Singelgracht Canal.

places.name: Royal Palace
places.about: Grand residence for royal receptions since 1808, open to the public & exhibitions when not in use.

places.name: Rijksmuseum
places.about: 19th-century building housing Dutch Golden Age painting masterpieces & vast European art collection.

places.name: Warsaw Old Town
places.about: The Old Town is a bustling tourism hub, with cobblestone alleys and medieval buildings reconstructed after WWII. At its heart is Rynek Starego Miasta, a busy square lined with burgher houses and upscale Po olish eateries. Nearby, St. John's Archcathedral dates back to the 14th century and hosts summer concerts. The area is also home to the restored apartments and manicured gardens of the Royal Castle.

places.name: ≈Åazienki Kr√≥lewskie
places.about: Stanis≈Çaw August's collections of paintings, drawings, sculpture & coins in lakeside palace.

places.name: Palace of Culture and Science
places.about: Landmark 1950s-built palace of arts & culture with theater, sports field & 30th-floor terrace.

places.name: The Royal Castle in Warsaw
places.about: Reconstructed 14th-century palace with an art collection & guided tours of the royal apartments.

places.name: Old Town Market Square
places.about: Medieval square with a famous mermaid statue, destroyed in 1944 & rebuilt after WWII.
